issues.description: The problem statement (UML and text) specifies a static method named calculateTotalPrice(Meal): int, but the solution implements a static method named computeMealCost(Meal) and the template's commented Main also calls computeMealCost. This name/signature mismatch between the specification and the provided solution/template will confuse students about the required API and may cause test failures if automated tests expect calculateTotalPrice.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the method name/signature across all artifacts. Prefer using the name from the problem statement: declare static int calculateTotalPrice(Meal) in SealSaloon (or update the problem statement/UML to use computeMealCost). Update any calls (Main, tests, templates) to use the chosen name so the API is consistent.

issues.description: Within the solution repository there is an internal inconsistency: the commented-out Main calls shop.calculateTotalPrice(...), but SealSaloon in the same repository only provides computeMealCost(...). This will cause confusion or compilation errors if the Main is uncommented or used for manual testing.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the solution repository self-consistent: either rename computeMealCost to calculateTotalPrice in SealSaloon, or change the Main to call computeMealCost. Ensure the chosen name matches the problem statement (prefer calculateTotalPrice) so students have a single canonical API to implement and test against.

issues.description: The problem statement's UML and text name the price-calculation method calculateTotalPrice(Meal): int, but the code examples in the template and the provided solution implement and call this functionality as computeMealCost(Meal). This is the same conceptual operation (calculate the total price/cost of a Meal) but referenced with two different identifiers across artifacts, which can confuse students: they may implement one name while tests or the other artifact expect the other name.
issues.suggested_fix: Use a single consistent name for the same operation across all artifacts. Either (A) change the problem statement and UML to refer to computeMealCost(Meal): int, or (B) rename the implementation and all references in the template and solution from computeMealCost to calculateTotalPrice (and update Main accordingly). Prefer aligning code to the problem UML (e.g., implement a static int calculateTotalPrice(Meal meal) and update references) so students clearly map the requirement to the implementation.
